Package edu.uiuc.ncsa.qdl.expressions

Expressions are objects that take zero or more arguments and return a result.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ExpressionNode
    This class mostly manages the structure of expressions (so arguments are the children) and evaluating them is delegating the result to the OpEvaluator class.
    SizeQuery
    Marker interface that queries a Monad, Dyad or Polyad for its size.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AllIndices
    Marker class to show all the indices are to be used.

    IndexList
    A simple list of indices for a stem.
    ModuleExpression
    Models a single module expression of the form A#expression where A is the alias giving the instance of the current module and expression is a general expression to be evaluated against the state of the module.
    Monad
    A post or prefix operator, such a logical not or ++.
    Nilad
    This would be an operator that takes no arguments.

    Polyad
    For multiple arguments.
    StemSubsettingNode
    This will allow for creating a subset (copy of portion) of a stem.

    UnevaluatedExpressionException
    Created by Jeff Gaynor

Package edu.uiuc.ncsa.qdl.expressions Description

Expressions are objects that take zero or more arguments and return a result. These are the classes that model this. he are processed by AbstractEvaluator and its subclasses.

Created by Jeff Gaynor
on 3/13/20 at 9:01 AM
